I recommend "Public Enemies" (2009) as it provides a thrilling look at the formative years of legendary American gangsters John Dillinger, Baby Face Nelson, and Pretty Boy Floyd during a booming crime wave in the 1930s.

Another option is to watch "The Rise of Theodore Roosevelt" (1979) which portrays the life of the iconic 26th President of the United States, from his transformation from a privileged New York politician to commander of the Rough Riders during the Spanish-American War.
